adrFormatAddress: 93 1st Ave. #2, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Christmas tree lights shine year-round inside this cash-only Indian restaurant. Bring your own beer.

originalText.text: Superb food and excellent service. I will definitely be returning. My son had a seafood combo, tandoori lamb, I had lamb biryani and for appetizer we had coconut samosas for drinks mango lassies. They also gave us complementary dessert. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful atmosphere and overall pleasurable dining experience.

text.text: Superb food and excellent service. I will definitely be returning. Beautiful atmosphere and overall pleasurable dining experience.

originalText.text:
Found this restaurant online and decided to pop in with family for a quick meal. The place has a lot of lights which would be cool if the lights weren‚Äôt so long that it hits you in the head when you stand up lol . The seating was WAY TOO TIGHT my family and the family next to us were basically sitting in each other lap we couldn‚Äôt even move the chair to get up to use the bathroom without disturbing each other.  when we asked for some space the waiter got upset .

the waiter we had was okay but kept interrupting our dinner reaching over our food to ask if if we wanted more water which was slightly annoying even after we declined multiple times .

The food wasn‚Äôt that good to me it was a little over cooked and I didn‚Äôt care for the spices used but I‚Äôm not much of an Indian food lover so please don‚Äôt go off my experience. The rice comes in a family style dish and you can ask them to refill when you‚Äôre ready for more. My son didn‚Äôt like the chicken he said it was tough , I had the lamb it was tender in my option not tasty .

For the overall service and food I don‚Äôt think it was worth the price . The restaurant is for the CASH ONLY and parking is tough around the area . Please be prepared.

It‚Äôs byob so bring your wine . Happy eating üçΩÔ∏è

originalText.text:
Food is delicious, and honestly would come back just for that and the vibes. It's also very well-priced. Decor is wild, you have to lean into the bit tho so for some people it might be uncomfortable. Some tables face flashing christmas lights so be conscientious of that if it's something you're sensitive to. Seating is very tight but it's comfortable once you're sat down. Our waiter took forever to bring the check tho, even got us complimentary ice cream before the check lol

If you're seated next to the doors during winter, good luck because they don't close behind people and other customers kept coming in and out üò≠

originalText.text: After 25 years of visiting this restaurant. I will never go back. I arrived 2 hours before closing time and was stopped at the door. I was told there was an issue with their stove. I said okay, can we get a drink? Him still barricading the door: no we dont have any. Me: you dont have any beverages? He finally let us in. There were other people inside eating and having a good time. We watched as they brought the other tables more hot items. We did not feel welcome or wanted. My friend traveled from North Carolina to visit Panna 2 and left feeling really uncomfortable about the whole thing. If you have more melanin than most, you may not be welcome either.

originalText.text: The atmosphere was so cool and unique here!! And really good food for an amazing deal and very good service!! Staff is super attentive and nice :)
